import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder, StandardScaler
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate target from predictors
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Encode categorical variables
categorical_features = [col for col in X_train.columns if X_train[col].dtype == 'object']
le = LabelEncoder()
for col in categorical_features:
    X_train[col] = le.fit_transform(X_train[col])
    X_test[col] = le.transform(X_test[col])

# Create preprocessing steps
numeric_features = [col for col in X_train.columns if X_train[col].dtype != 'object']
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', StandardScaler(), numeric_features),
    ])

# Define pipeline
pipeline = Pipeline(steps=[('preprocessor', preprocessor),
                           ('classifier', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100))])

# Fit model
pipeline.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred = pipeline.predict(X_test)

# Save predictions to CSV
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_df['Id'], 'SalePrice': y_pred})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder, StandardScaler
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate target from predictors
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Encode categorical variables separately for train and test
categorical_features = [col for col in X_train.columns if X_train[col].dtype == 'object']

# Initialize the encoder
le = LabelEncoder()

# Fit and transform the train data
for col in categorical_features:
    X_train[col] = le.fit_transform(X_train[col])

# Only transform the test data
for col in categorical_features:
    X_test[col] = le.transform(X_test[col])

# Create preprocessing steps
numeric_features = [col for col in X_train.columns if X_train[col].dtype != 'object']
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', StandardScaler(), numeric_features),
    ])

# Define pipeline
pipeline = Pipeline(steps=[('preprocessor', preprocessor),
                           ('classifier', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100))])

# Fit model
pipeline.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred = pipeline.predict(X_test)

# Save predictions to CSV
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_df['Id'], 'SalePrice': y_pred})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder, StandardScaler
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate target from predictors
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Encode categorical variables separately for train and test
categorical_features = [col for col in X_train.columns if X_train[col].dtype == 'object']

# Initialize the encoder
le = LabelEncoder()

# Fit the encoder on the train data and transform both train and test data
for col in categorical_features:
    X_train[col] = le.fit_transform(X_train[col])
    X_test[col] = le.transform(X_test[col])

# Create preprocessing steps
numeric_features = [col for col in X_train.columns if X_train[col].dtype != 'object']
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', StandardScaler(), numeric_features),
    ])

# Define pipeline
pipeline = Pipeline(steps=[('preprocessor', preprocessor),
                           ('classifier', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100))])

# Fit model
pipeline.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred = pipeline.predict(X_test)

# Save predictions to CSV
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_df['Id'], 'SalePrice': y_pred})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder, StandardScaler
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate target from predictors
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Encode categorical variables separately for train and test
categorical_features = [col for col in X_train.columns if X_train[col].dtype == 'object']

# Initialize the encoder
le = LabelEncoder()

# Fit the encoder on the train data and transform both train and test data
for col in categorical_features:
    le.fit(X_train[col].unique())
    X_train[col] = le.transform(X_train[col])
    X_test[col] = le.transform(X_test[col])

# Create preprocessing steps
numeric_features = [col for col in X_train.columns if X_train[col].dtype != 'object']
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', StandardScaler(), numeric_features),
    ])

# Define pipeline
pipeline = Pipeline(steps=[('preprocessor', preprocessor),
                           ('classifier', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100))])

# Fit model
pipeline.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred = pipeline.predict(X_test)

# Save predictions to CSV
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_df['Id'], 'SalePrice': y_pred})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, StandardScaler
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate target from predictors
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Encode categorical variables separately for train and test
categorical_features = [col for col in X_train.columns if X_train[col].dtype == 'object']

# Initialize the encoder
enc = OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore')

# Fit the encoder on the train data and transform both train and test data
encoded_train = enc.fit_transform(X_train[categorical_features]).toarray()
encoded_test = enc.transform(X_test[categorical_features]).toarray()

# Concatenate encoded features with numeric features
X_train_encoded = pd.DataFrame(encoded_train, columns=enc.get_feature_names_out(categorical_features))
X_test_encoded = pd.DataFrame(encoded_test, columns=enc.get_feature_names_out(categorical_features))

X_train_final = pd.concat([X_train[numeric_features], X_train_encoded], axis=1)
X_test_final = pd.concat([X_test[numeric_features], X_test_encoded], axis=1)

# Create preprocessing steps
numeric_features = [col for col in X_train_final.columns if X_train_final[col].dtype != 'object']
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', StandardScaler(), numeric_features),
    ])

# Define pipeline
pipeline = Pipeline(steps=[('preprocessor', preprocessor),
                           ('classifier', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100))])

# Fit model
pipeline.fit(X_train_final, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred = pipeline.predict(X_test_final)

# Sav

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, StandardScaler
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate target from predictors
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Encode categorical variables separately for train and test
categorical_features = [col for col in X_train.columns if X_train[col].dtype == 'object']

# Initialize the encoder
enc = OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore')

# Fit the encoder on the train data and transform both train and test data
encoded_train = enc.fit_transform(X_train[categorical_features]).toarray()
encoded_test = enc.transform(X_test[categorical_features]).toarray()

# Concatenate encoded features with numeric features
X_train_final = pd.concat([X_train.drop(categorical_features, axis=1), pd.DataFrame(encoded_train, columns=enc.get_feature_names_out(categorical_features))], axis=1)
X_test_final = pd.concat([X_test.drop(categorical_features, axis=1), pd.DataFrame(encoded_test, columns=enc.get_feature_names_out(categorical_features))], axis=1)

# Create preprocessing steps
numeric_features = [col for col in X_train_final.columns if X_train_final[col].dtype != 'object']
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[

    ])

# Define pipeline

# Fit model
